page.title: 05Housing
page.content: Contemporary planning regulations limit new building in either Tunstall or Halvergate. Agricultural building is allowed at the discression of the planning commitee. Only Halvergate is allowed residential housing as relacement or infill. Tunstall consists of two farms with three farm houses. The remaining twenty houses are either council owned or tied cottages. There has been no building since the 1940s. Halvergate has two farms and farmhouses and Halvergate Hall which is no longer a farm. Twenty furthur houses are either tied or council. The remaining 100 houses are all owner occupied, most were built 1960-1970, some however are centuries old. There is no derelict housing in these areas.
